content.body: fwiw `#` already means private fields so it's not necessarily a home run
content.formatted_body: fwiw # already means private fields so it's not necessarily a home run

content.body:
That is true. Of course, that problem is shared with `#`-based composite literals, too. 

And every choice of pipe topic left (`^^`, `@@`, `#_`, etc.) also has problems with visual association. I suppose one could argue that binary `^` is relatively rare.

I still think the [formulae in the wiki](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pipeline-operator/wiki/Bikeshedding-the-Hack-topic-token#criteria-for-choosing-the-token) are pretty good heuristics.
content.formatted_body:
That is true. Of course, that problem is shared with #-based composite literals, too.

And every choice of pipe topic left (^^, @@, #_, etc.) also has problems with visual association. I suppose one could argue that binary ^ is relatively rare.

I still think the formulae in the wiki are pretty good heuristics.

content.body: I still think we want to allow for # to be a metacharacter, since we're *nearly* out of ASCII syntax, so we'd want `##` for the topic.
content.formatted_body: I still think we want to allow for # to be a metacharacter, since we're nearly out of ASCII syntax, so we'd want ## for the topic.
